actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Procurement and Military Nuclear Systems.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Procurement and Military Nuclear Systems

official_title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to require that, in the case of defense acquisition programs that are designated as special access program, certain total program cost and program schedule information must be disclosed to Congress after those programs have passed a level of outlays of $50,000,000 or more.

summary.text: Amends Federal defense acquisition provisions to require the Secretary of Defense to report on program cost and schedule information to the Senate and House Armed Services Committees whenever obligations for a defense special access program (a classified program) exceed $50,000,000.

titles.title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to require that, in the case of defense acquisition programs that are designated as special access program, certain total program cost and program schedule information must be disclosed to Congress after those programs have passed a level of outlays of $50,000,000 or more.
